byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and AL BAKER

abstract: United States monitor Peter L Zimroth finds that some New York City police officers are detaining people for questioning but not documenting it, raising questions of whether significant decline in stop-and-frisk activity is accurate.
lead_paragraph: The finding, in the first report from a federal monitor overseeing the Police Department, calls into doubt the official accounting of a significant decline in stop-and-frisk activity.

headline.main: New York Police Department Is Undercounting Street Stops, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Police Are Undercounting Street Stops, U.S. Monitor Finds

snippet: The finding, in the first report from a federal monitor overseeing the Police Department, calls into doubt the official accounting of a significant decline in stop-and-frisk activity.
